availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married Judith Catherine Mabry. Father of Rodolphus A. Mabry, Samuel Mabry, McHenry Mabry, Safrona Mabry, Luelia C. Mabry, Jesse J. Mabry, Mildred Mabry, Winston Mabry, and Olivia. Farmer in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 2, p. 375. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 16. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 4. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District 3, p. 11. Find A Grave, "Charles Jones ‘Charlie’ Mabry (1819-1882)," Memorial #115653194, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=115653194&ref=acom (accessed June 22, 2017).
